intro: Arachnothryx rekoi, commonly known as the African velvetleaf, is a tropical shrub native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain regions.
